item.title: Blizzard hits US Northeast bringing cities to standstill, closing schools and disrupting flights
item.description: A record-breaking snowstorm pummels the north-eastern United States, bringing cities to a near-standstill for millions of residents.

item.title: Former Matildas label new Football Australia membership program a 'silencing mechanism'
item.description: A new membership program launched by Football Australia puts former Matildas players in a difficult position if they want to criticise the governing body.

item.title: Globetrotting ancient marine amphibians uncovered in lucky Kimberley fossil rediscovery
item.description: A salamander-crocodile type predator survived five extinction events and travelled from waters off Norway to WA's Kimberley coast.

item.title: Essential Caravans buys Zone RV, but customers left short-changed
item.description: A Melbourne-based company has purchased Zone RV, but customers who collectively paid millions before its collapse will be left out of pocket.

item.title: Thousands without power as intense storms sweep across Melbourne
item.description: Storms dumped 50 millimetres of rain on parts of Victoria on Tuesday and cut power to thousands of homes.

item.title: Could Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor be removed from the line of succession?
item.description: Is it possible to remove him? The short answer is yes — but it would most likely be a time-consuming process involving many parliaments passing legislation.

item.title: Gus Lamont's parents release public statement saying their lives have been 'shattered'
item.description: The parents of missing four-year-old Gus Lamont have released a public statement, saying "every moment without him is unbearable".

item.title: Australia's women's team wins first ODI against India by six wickets
item.description: Half-centuries to Alyssa Healy and Beth Mooney help lead Australia to a six-wicket win over India in the first ODI.

item.title: Explosive detection dog Flo Joe posthumously awarded for military service in Afghanistan
item.description: In July 2007, explosive detection dog Flo Joe became the first Australian service dog to locate an improvised explosive device in Afghanistan. Today, she was posthumously recognised for her military service.

item.title: Popular WA outback tourist property Wooleen Station to be sold
item.description: A pastoral station in WA's Murchison region which has become a high-profile example of conservation is to be sold.

item.title: Half the country on flood watch as summer storms bring deluge of rain
item.description: There are widespread warnings for intense rain and potential flooding, as summer storms hit southern states and an unusually slow-moving system soaks central Australia.

item.title: Australians will be among first to arrive in UK amid controversial new passport changes
item.description: Australians flying to the United Kingdom tonight will be among the first in the world to arrive under controversial new border rules.

item.title: WA government announces $140m plan to prevent repeat of record-breaking flu season
item.description: Creating more beds and boosting immunisation are key features of a $140 million "winter strategy" aimed at avoiding a repeat of WA's worst-ever flu season.

item.title: Fire ant authority considers penalties for business that spread nests to central Qld
item.description: The National Fire Ant Eradication Program is considering "enforcement actions" for a business accused of spreading nests to Queensland mine sites via a shipment of bricks.

item.title: University of Notre Dame abruptly halts new enrolments in nursing course
item.description: Staff and prospective students say they have been left in the dark about why the university cancelled new nursing and midwifery students in the first semester of 2026.

item.title: Inquest into Aboriginal woman's death in custody hears of daughters' grief from losing 'loving mother'
item.description: Tammy Shipley died in a NSW prison cell in December 2022 after consuming excessive water, a complication of schizoaffective disorder known as polydipsia. Today her children told a coronial inquest that "if love could have saved her, she could have lived forever".

item.title: Gynaecologist referred to police after Four Corners report
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: WIN Network acquires Nine Darwin, expanding broadcast operations into the NT
item.description: Regional news broadcaster WIN has announced it will acquire Nine Darwin, just over a year after the Nine Network suddenly axed its Darwin TV news bulletin.

item.title: Anthony Albanese evacuated from The Lodge following security incident
item.description: The incident at Mr Albanese's Canberra residence led to the prime minister being taken to another location for several hours.

item.title: Russell Brand pleads not guilty to further rape, sex assault charges
item.description: British actor and comedian Russell Brand pleads not guilty in a London court to two additional charges of rape and sexual assault nearly two decades ago.

item.title: Reawakening
item.description: The Bondi Beach terrorist attack signalled the resurgence of the Islamic State terrorist group in Australia. For the past two years, ABC Investigations has tracked the group's revival, identifying key figures, mapping the network and raising questions about the response of police, intelligence agencies and governments.

item.title: Former Philippine leader Rodrigo Duterte drew up 'death lists' and boasted about murders, ICC prosecutors say
item.description: Former Philippines president Rodrigo Duterte personally drew up "death lists" and boasted about murders committed during his "war on drugs", an International Criminal Court prosecutor alleges at a crimes against humanity hearing.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie's family offers $1.42m reward to bring home missing mother Nancy
item.description: US TV host Savannah Guthrie has posted a video to Instagram offering a $US1 million ($1.42 million) reward for information leading to the recovery of her missing mother Nancy Guthrie.

item.title: Travel quiz, February 25: Can you win our race around the world?
item.description: Which European city is home to the Rijksmuseum? And which dance style is Argentina best known for?

item.title: Gay and bisexual Sydney teenagers lured and bashed on camera in IS-inspired attacks
item.description: An ABC investigation has obtained distressing videos and victims' accounts of IS sympathisers hunting and bashing gay and bisexual boys on camera in Sydney.

item.title: UK entry passport changes come into effect for dual citizens today. Here is what you need to know
item.description: Your guide to the dual citizen entry requirements for the UK that are coming into effect today.

item.title: Endometriosis sufferers fear progress could be undone by one surgeon
item.description: Endometriosis sufferers have been left "sick" and reeling over the findings of a months-long ABC investigation into a Melbourne gynaecologist.

item.title: Four years of war in Ukraine leaves Russia a 'spent force' with diminished influence, analyst says
item.description: For the first time since its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has lost troops faster than it can replace them. It's one of many grim milestones of a bloody war that has now been going for four years.

item.title: SA Labor's stamp duty policy appears at odds with former treasurer Stephen Mullighan's views
item.description: SA Labor has announced a plan to abolish stamp duty for those aged over 60 and planning to downsize at the party's election campaign launch, in what seems to be a major policy shift from the position detailed by the state's former treasurer.

item.title: Irma Palasics's husband recounts her brutal murder in violent home invasion
item.description: A jury has watched hospital footage of Irma Palasics's husband describing the night she was killed in 1999, as two men stand trial over her death.

item.title: Australian Chamber Orchestra welcomes 416yo Italian viola into its collection
item.description: The instrument is believed to be one of the finest tenor violas in existence and the only surviving example of its kind.

item.title: UK government supports release of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's trade envoy documents
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested last week on suspicion of misconduct in public office amid claims he shared confidential government information with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Hundreds of former prisoners potentially exposed to HIV and hepatitis C after a prisoner shared needles
item.description: A Queensland Health communique has revealed hundreds of former prisoners were potentially exposed to HIV and hepatitis C after an inmate shared injecting equipment in prison.

item.title: Scott Vincent Ward charged with allegedly grooming Philippines mother to sexually abuse her children
item.description: The man was searched by Australian Border Force officers when he arrived at Brisbane Airport after returning to Australia on a flight from the Philippines.

item.title: Albanese urges country to 'turn the heat down' after bomb threat — as it happened
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has called for the heat to be taken out of political debate following a bomb threat on The Lodge.

item.title: Pilot study into early diagnosis of pancreatic cancer by screening diabetes patients to launch in Brisbane
item.description: The study is the first step into investigating whether pancreatic cancer screening — via a non-invasive CT scan — could help save lives by early detection or warning signs.

item.title: Thirteen million trees to be replanted after pine plantation wiped out in Walwa-Mt Lawson fire
item.description: The fire threat in Victoria's Upper Murray has eased, but the region's famously green, undulating hills still bear the black scars of a devastating bushfire.

item.title: ASX 200 hits new high, Australian dollar climbing — as it happened
item.description: The local share market is at record levels, while the Australian dollar is climbing after inflation was steady at 3.8 per cent in January. WiseTech and Woolworths shares surge.

item.title: Mount Isa experiences most February rain on record
item.description: Dry red dirt turns to flowing rivers and lakes as heavy rainfall breaks a century-old record in Mount Isa.

item.title: Iran signs 'secret' $700m deal for Russian air defence systems, reports say
item.description: Iran has reportedly signed a secret arms deal with Russia to acquire thousands of advanced shoulder-fired missiles to help boost its air defences.

item.title: SA council sustainability rankings spark amalgamation debate
item.description: Council amalgamation is being discussed in South Australia, where multiple local governments have been ranked as unsustainable.

item.title: Thai officials say 72 tiger deaths at tourist parks not caused by bird flu
item.description: Thai authorities say tigers in confined environments can be particularly vulnerable to the canine distemper viral infection.

item.title: Indigenous landscape board chair resigns amid investigation into Telstra
item.description: The Alinytjara Wiluṟara Landscape Board chair steps down, saying his ability to speak for a region where Telstra is under investigation for alleged environmental breaches was impeded.

item.title: Perth doctor Rhys Bellinge's 'entitled, callous' behaviour killed Elizabeth Pearce and ruined lives, court told
item.description: Sought-after obstetrician Rhys Bellinge appeared to have it all — but that changed in an instant when his drunken, high-speed driving killed a young university graduate and left a rideshare driver with permanent injuries.

item.title: Wittenoom traditional owners launch $1.5b asbestos contamination claim against WA government
item.description: Banjima traditional owners say the thousands of hectares left poisoned by decades of asbestos mining have caused one of the highest death rates of mesothelioma in the world.

item.title: Lake Moondarra overspills for the first time since since 2011
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Yuin elder and public educator Aunty Ruth Simms publishes first children's book, Muttonfish Magic
item.description: Aunty Ruth Simms has published her first book, Muttonfish Magic, as she prepares to celebrate five decades in the public education system.

item.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine unbroken after four years, but Russia vows to fight on
item.description: World leaders gather in Kyiv to mark four years since the launch of Moscow's full scale invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Esperance farmers grapple with feral pig surge in WA's south-east
item.description: Farmers call for government support to curb the number of feral pigs in WA's south-east after a rapid jump in numbers.

item.title: Born in a Taxi and Osadía to bring roving performance magic to WOMADelaide
item.description: Melbourne's Born in a Taxi will join Spain's Osadía in bringing their unique performances to the world music festival next weekend, but they point out street theatre has not always been received well.

item.title: Lizzie McGuire and Revenge of the Nerds star Robert Carradine dies at 71
item.description: Robert Carradine — the youngest member of a legendary Hollywood family — dies, with his loved ones revealing his struggle with bipolar disorder.

item.title: Trump swipes at Supreme Court in longest State of the Union speech — as it happened
item.description: US President Donald Trump has addressed Congress in the annual State of the Union speech. Take a look back at how events unfolded.

item.title: Mexico's president insists 'no risk' as cartel clashes fuel worries in lead-up to FIFA World Cup
item.description: Claudia Sheinbaum says there is "no risk" to fans coming to the country to attend FIFA World Cup games despite the recent capture and death of Mexico's most-wanted cartel leader.

item.title: Truckie charged over crash which killed two train drivers has died, court told
item.description: A truck driver charged over a fatal crash which killed two freight train drivers at a level crossing on the Barrier Highway has died.

item.title: Security threat prompting PM evacuation linked to intimidation of Chinese dancers
item.description: The prime minister was forced to evacuate the Lodge last night due to a bomb threat linked to performances in Australia by a classical Chinese dance and music group that is banned in China.

item.title: Australian man Peter Williams given seven years' jail for selling US trade secrets to Russian broker
item.description: A judge in Washington has sentenced Australian man Peter Williams to 87 months in prison for selling sensitive information to a Russian broker.

item.title: Woman's family sues NT government over Tennant Creek watch house death
item.description: The family of a woman who died in police custody in Tennant Creek is suing the Northern Territory government for negligence, alleging officers failed in their duty of care after her arrest and that the 44-year-old was held in an "overheated" cell.

item.title: Teenager denies driving car that crashed on Canberra road killing 15yo passenger
item.description: A Canberra boy on trial for manslaughter denies being behind the wheel of a stolen car that crashed and killed another teenager outside Parliament House.

item.title: "Our country is winning again": Trump invites US men's hockey team to Congress
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Trump takes swipe at US Supreme Court over tariff ruling
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: WA man who tried to set police officer on fire sentenced to four years in prison
item.description: Ian Wally attempted to use a jerry can full of petrol to set a Perth police officer on fire.

item.title: Southern Downs Regional Council rejects developer's proposal for water bottling facility on Cherrabah
item.description: Farmers say their fight continues after the local council knocked back a Chinese company's bid to extract almost 100 million litres of groundwater a year to bottle and sell.

item.title: What is duty sex and how do you stop having it?
item.description: Obligatory or duty sex is most common in long-term relationships, but can also happen in casual relationships where sex is the basis of the connection.

item.title: Connor Rogers learning to walk again after terrifying knee injury
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: WA's population on track to reach 4 million by 2043 amid housing shortfall
item.description: Four million people are tipped to live in Western Australia by 2043 according to a new report which warns the boom could be derailed by a housing shortage.

item.title: Troy Maskell found guilty of 73-year-old Strathmerton postmaster's manslaughter in retrial
item.description: A jury has found Troy Matthew Maskell guilty of a 73-year-old Strathmerton postmaster's manslaughter during a retrial ordered due to inadmissible evidence.

item.title: Alleged bomb threat against Gold Coast's HOTA theatre over Chinese dance group
item.description: Shen Yun has been the subject of several threats, including one against Australia's prime minister on Monday.

item.title: Angus Taylor says federal Liberals must 'do better' as he joins Ashton Hurn in Adelaide
item.description: Opposition leader Angus Taylor responds to SA Liberal leader Ashton Hurn's criticism of her federal counterparts, as he joins her on the state campaign trail in Adelaide.

item.title: Outback SA and NSW record up to 200mm overnight, with another 100mm of rain forecast
item.description: Some pastoralists have already recorded 215mm of rain overnight, with the coming days forecast to bring an additional 100mm in some parts north-east of SA and far west NSW.

item.title: Rhys Bellinge manslaughter sentence supported by Roger Cook, but Basil Zempilas disagrees
item.description: WA's political leaders are at odds over the sentence given to obstetrician Rhys Bellinge for a fatal drunken car accident, with Premier Roger Cook backing it and Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas saying it was "on the light side."

item.title: Canberra man accused of sexually assaulting woman he held captive tells jury he was under attack
item.description: A man accused of holding a woman captive and sexually assaulting her until she fled naked into a Canberra street has told a jury he was the one under attack.

item.title: Australia at risk of 'supercharged' harm from unregulated AI, Toby Walsh warns
item.description: Renowned AI expert Toby Walsh has used a National Press Club address to warn the Australian government about what he argues are inadequate approaches to regulating the technology.

item.title: Public sector workers 'furious' as Tasmanian government denies reneging on pay deal
item.description: The Tasmanian government has labelled claims it reneged on a pay agreement as "incorrect" and says it is disappointed the unions are labelling recent talks in that way.

item.title: Standout moments from Donald Trump's State of the Union speech
item.description: The president gives the longest State of the Union speech in US history, delivering a 108-minute address to shatter Bill Clinton's 89-minute record.

item.title: Teenager first in SA to be prosecuted for allegedly creating deepfake images
item.description: A suppression order has been lifted on the identity of the first South Australian man to be prosecuted for allegedly creating and sharing sexually explicit deepfake images.

item.title: WiseTech Global to cut 2,000 jobs as AI ends era of 'manually writing code'
item.description: The company says almost one third of staff across 40 countries would be affected by the redundancies as a move towards AI sees a reshaping of its workforce.

item.title: Edith Cowan University's $853 million Perth CBD campus evacuated three days into first semester
item.description: The brand new Edith Cowan University precinct in Perth's CBD is evacuated, with hundreds of students pouring into city streets just three days into the first semester.

item.title: President Donald Trump's State of the Union address in detail
item.description: Standing in front of allies, Olympians and victims of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Donald Trump has delivered his annual State of the Union address. Let's take a closer look at it.

item.title: Donald Trump's showmanship distracts from all that was riding on his State of the Union address
item.description: Donald Trump's showmanship and supreme confidence can easily distract from the fact that he had a lot riding on his State of the Union address.

item.title: Evelyn Araluen wins $100,000 Victorian Prize for Literature for poetry collection, The Rot
item.description: Eveyln Araluen has taken out the top award at the Victorian Premier's Literary Awards for The Rot, the follow up to her award-winning debut, Dropbear.

item.title: Where is Gus Lamont?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Commonwealth Bank prepares for the AI revolution
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Algal bloom report blames 'convergence' of factors, but ecologist questions flood finding
item.description: The SA environment minister says preliminary results of an investigation into the causes of the harmful algal bloom back up what scientists had long suspected, but an ecologist who has criticised the government's response says more detail needs to be released.

item.title: International student allegedly carrying child abuse material stopped at Adelaide Airport, ABF says
item.description: A Chinese national intending to study early childhood education in Australia has had his visa cancelled after Australian Border Force officers checked his baggage at Adelaide Airport and allegedly found "21 videos deemed to be child abuse material".

item.title: Khaled Sabsabi to exhibit two new works at Venice Biennale after controversial dumping and reinstatement
item.description: Last year, Khaled Sabsabi was dumped from the Venice Biennale to avoid "divisive debate". Now, he announces his work will feature in both the main exhibition and the Australia Pavilion.

item.title: NT Administrator David Connolly apologises over social media controversy
item.description: Just a day before being sworn in as the Northern Territory's new representative for King Charles III, NT Administrator David Connolly has apologised over a social media furore.

item.title: Man dies, woman in hospital following unit fire at St Marys, Western Sydney
item.description: A man dies and a woman is taken to hospital in a serious but stable condition after a unit fire at St Marys in Sydney's west.

item.title: Japan to deploy missile systems on island near Taiwan by 2031, defence minister says
item.description: Japan's government plans to deploy surface-to-air missiles on one of its remote western islands near Taiwan by March 2031, the country's defence minister says.

item.title: Call to find paintings by Tasmanian colonial-era artist William Charles Piguenit
item.description: Experts believe "countless" artworks by a famed colonial artist could be sitting in Tasmanian homes, with the owners unaware of their true value.

item.title: Great Ocean Road tourism operators plead for visitors to return as flood and fires cause financial hit
item.description: Business owners hope visitors will return to communities along the Great Ocean Road after they lost money during a summer of natural disasters.

item.title: Mamma Mia! star Amanda Seyfried tackles her wildest musical yet
item.description: The Oscar-nominated star adored working with director Mona Fastvold to resurrect an astonishing religious figure in The Testament of Ann Lee.

item.title: More Australians switching to 'riskier' super funds, as industry calls for tighter regulation
item.description: More young Australians with less super are moving away from tightly regulated super funds to platform-based or self-managed super funds.

item.title: Australia's first Deafblind class created in mainstream public school
item.description: Australia's first Deafblind class in a mainstream school has been established after a mother spent two years advocating for her son.

item.title: The numbers that show political violence is on the rise in Australia
item.description: Spitting, assault and online abuse are rising signs of a dangerous political culture in Australia.

item.title: Suspected serial offender linked to Islamic State walks free over filmed gay bashing
item.description: A suspected serial violent homophobe linked to an Islamic State terrorist network has walked free on probation after pleading guilty to a brutal snuff-video-style gay bashing.

item.title: Female athletes found to fear 'nothing is going to happen' when speaking out on gender-based violence
item.description: Experiences shared by athletes who participated in the ABC's Elite Athletes in Australian Women's Sport survey found many fear "nothing is going to happen" when speaking out on gender-based violence and harassment.

item.title: SA, Victoria and parts of NSW forecast to receive heaviest rain in over a decade
item.description: The tropical low currently flooding outback Australia is tipped to track south this weekend, reaching south-east states early next week.

item.title: Adelaide theatre company Slingsby says funding loss forces final curtain call
item.description: Key figures from Adelaide-based family theatre company Slingsby have decided to let the curtain drop for the final time after missing out on federal government funding.

item.title: Larry Summers to resign from Harvard over Jeffrey Epstein ties
item.description: The former US Treasury secretary says it was a "difficult decision" and he will leave at the end of the academic year.

item.title: Support options for those who receive inappropriate medical treatment for endometriosis
item.description: If allegations that a surgeon performed surgery for "severe" endometriosis on women with little or no sign of the disease have you questioning your own treatment, here is where you can voice your concerns.

item.title: Iceland to hold referendum on joining EU a decade after abandoning membership talks
item.description: In 2013, Reykjavik abandoned EU membership talks after four years of negotiations, but rising living costs and the ongoing war in Ukraine have rekindled the island nation's interest in joining the bloc.

item.title: Tasmanian treasurer to consider slashing high-earner public servant retirement payments
item.description: The Tasmanian government is considering reducing the superannuation given to high-earning public servants as a way of reining in its $7 billion unfunded superannuation liability, the ABC understands.

item.title: Central Australia tropical low expected to linger for days as flooding cuts off towns
item.description: Record rainfall brought by a tropical low across Central Australia continues to run through Western Queensland, cutting off some key roads between towns.

item.title: Middle East situation 'fast-moving', deputy PM says — as it happened
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles says the situation in the Middle East is "fast-moving" as the government moves to evacuate dependents of Australian diplomats from Israel and Lebanon.

item.title: ASX hits another Qantas tumbles on flat profit, Optus accused of 'lack of care' culture — as it happened
item.description: The ASX nailed its second successive record close, buoyed by tech stocks and miners while Qantas tumbled after a disappointing set of results

item.title: Expanded Newcastle Art Gallery finally opens after decades of turmoil
item.description: It has been two decades in the making, but the troubled Newcastle Art Gallery expansion is finally opening its doors.

item.title: Guide to Listening: ABC Classic's Festival of Female Composers and International Women's Day on ABC Jazz
item.description: For 10 years, in the lead-up to International Women's Day, ABC Classic has celebrated classical music by women across centuries. Here's what's in store for 2026.

item.title: Prosecutor's breach of WA evidence rules triggers retrial for man accused of child sex offences
item.description: A man found guilty of sexually abusing his stepdaughters wins a retrial because a "serious breach" by a prosecutor resulted in a "miscarriage of justice".

item.title: Gary Foley Collection tells activism history through Aboriginal lens
item.description: The ABC gets a rare look at the Aboriginal History Archive, a little-known collection of thousands of items collected by the well-known activist Gary Foley.

item.title: Australians fear falling victim to AI-related crimes, deepfakes and hacks, research shows
item.description: More than half of Australian adults are worried about AI being used to cause them harm, and almost as many fear falling victim to a crime enabled by the technology, a report found.

item.title: What is Shen Yun, the group named in a threat against Prime Minister Anthony Albanese?
item.description: Police are investigating a bomb threat against a Gold Coast theatre hosting a classical Chinese dance group after a threat was also made against the prime minister's official residence.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Albanese calls Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor a 'grub' and Grace Tame 'difficult'
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: US tariffs on Australia remain at 10 per cent — for now
item.description: Trade Minister Don Farrell hopes Australia can dodge a higher tariff rate being imposed by the US, saying trade officials overnight confirmed the tariff rate on Australia would remain at 10 per cent — at least for now.

item.title: New Shanghai Chinese restaurant in Katherine rocked by pre-dawn machete attack, carjacking
item.description: A Top End Chinese restaurant manager says the eatery's staff have left town after its chef was allegedly threatened with a knife in a pre-dawn carjacking.

item.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock calls for patience as rate decisions get harder
item.description: Michelle Bullock gives more details on how quickly developments affecting monetary policy have moved since the middle of last year.

item.title: Former Australian of the Year Grace Tame responds to Anthony Albanese's 'difficult life' apology
item.description: Grace Tame criticises Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's qualified apology after he described her as "difficult", saying "what a patronising cop-out".

item.title: INXS nominated for induction into Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
item.description: INXS will be considered for induction into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame and is one of 10 first-time nominees on the ballot.

item.title: Gas giant Arrow Energy takes Australia's biggest pork producer to court over gas pipelines
item.description: A major energy company is taking Australia's largest pork producer to court over plans to build gas pipelines through its property on Queensland's Western Downs.

item.title: National bushfire outlook puts NSW, Victoria and southern WA at heightened risk
item.description: The latest seasonal bushfire outlook has identified large parts of Victoria, NSW and southern WA as still at risk, even though summer is almost over.

item.title: Children in Syrian camp for ISIS-linked families speak of hopes to return to Australia
item.description: The children of women with ISIS links stuck in a Syrian refugee camp talk about their attempt to leave last week, saying they dream of one day buying toys and ice cream in Australia.

item.title: Sunset Strip residents learn water unsafe even for washing in after 66 years using it to brush teeth
item.description: Residents in Sunset Strip knew their water was not safe to drink, but it came as a great shock to read a letter stating it was not safe to bathe in or wash with either.

item.title: Hundreds of former patients of gynaecologist Simon Gordon join support group
item.description: More former patients of Melbourne gynaecologist Simon Gordon have come forward to express distress over their treatment with many joining a newly-formed private support group.

item.title: Defence lawyers argue Greg Lynn 'cannot possibly' have fair retrial this year, as 59-year-old makes bail bid
item.description: The Supreme Court of Victoria hears the former Jetstar pilot's application to be bailed ahead of his retrial over the alleged 2020 murder of Carol Clay in Victoria's High Country.

item.title: Senator Sarah Hanson-Young calls for Triple Zero overhaul at Optus outage hearing
item.description: A Senate committee hears bombshell testimony about Optus's processes during an outage that led to the deaths of multiple customers who were unable to call Triple Zero.

item.title: Debate about children of 'ISIS brides' has become hyper-politicised
item.description: The fate of the "ISIS brides" is inextricably linked to constitutional facts but the debate about their future is not taking place in a legal chamber — it is being fought in the court of public opinion.

item.title: Qantas shares fall more than 6 per cent after first-half profit announced
item.description: Qantas' first-half profit result has disappointed shareholders, but chief executive Vanessa Hudson says the airline's largest fleet renewal in history will pay off.

item.title: Donald Trump says Muslim congresswomen should be 'sent back from where they came' over State of the Union clash
item.description: US President Donald Trump says two Muslim Democratic politicians should be sent back to "where they came" from after a heated exchange during his State of the Union address.

item.title: Australians will receive nationwide mobile alert in July under emergency notification trial
item.description: Most Australians will receive a mobile phone alert in July this year, as part of a nationwide test of a new emergency warning system.

item.title: Pro-democracy Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai's fraud offence overturned
item.description: Hong Kong's Court of Appeal overturns the lower court ruling against Jimmy Lai on a fraud offence.

item.title: Christopher Turner jailed over fatal gas mix-up at Bankstown-Lidcombe Hospital
item.description: Newborn John Ghanem died, while baby Amelia Khan suffered severe and permanent brain damage when they were inadvertently given nitrous oxide instead of oxygen after their births.

item.title: What is mammalian meat allergy and how do you develop it?
item.description: Jeremy Webb's death in 2022 from a tick-induced red meat allergy is the first to be recorded in Australia. Here's what we know about mammalian meat allergy and how to avoid it.

item.title: Mother and daughter discover largest known coral on Great Barrier Reef
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Coral colony discovered by mother and daughter citizen scientists could be world's largest
item.description: Mother and daughter citizen scientists find what is believed to be the largest coral colony on the Great Barrier Reef and possibly in the world.

item.title: How an onstage clash between a future NT administrator and a political hopeful drew battle lines
item.description: A keynote speaker shoved an environmental activist at a conference in 2023. Now, one of them is the Northern Territory's next administrator.

item.title: High levels of E. coli and dead fish found in River Torrens, causing a stink
item.description: Rowers have had to move their training and a boat operator has held off bookings after high levels of E. coli were detected alongside dead fish on a stretch of the River Torrens in Adelaide.

item.title: Basil Zempilas apologises to Swan Hills MP Michelle Maynard after incident in WA Parliament
item.description: WA Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas apologises to a Labor backbencher who says she felt "intimidated" by him when he stood over her in parliament on Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: Man, two girls injured after suspected lightning strikes during Perth storm
item.description: Two teenage girls and a man in his 70s are receiving medical care after lightning strikes in Perth.

item.title: SA coroner recommends life jacket rule change after boating deaths
item.description: South Australia's coroner has recommended the state "lead the nation" by making it mandatory for people to wear a life jacket when aboard any boat up to 7 metres in length.

item.title: Hikers found after 24-hour rescue mission in Snowy Mountains
item.description: Emergency service crews have conducted a 24-hour rescue mission, involving 350 metres of a vertical climb, to locate two hikers who became stranded on a ledge in the Snowy Mountains.

item.title: Abattoir Beaufort River Meats halts operations as $20m in live export transition grants are rolled out
item.description: Forty farming families and five processors have secured live sheep transition funding from more than 260 applicants, including Beaufort River Meats in the Great Southern, which has temporarily shut down amid ongoing livestock shortages.

item.title: Foreign terror attacks could be used to enact NSW's protest laws, activists argue
item.description: The demonstrators are arguing in the state's highest court that the laws introduced by Premier Chris Minns after the Bondi Beach terror attack should be ruled unconstitutional.

item.title: Albanese's week unravelled by one-word description of Grace Tame
item.description: The prime minister was this week evacuated from the Lodge over a bomb threat and later got stuck in a tit-for-tat with a former Australian of the Year.

item.title: Switzerland's Crumbling Giants
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Dingo advocates call for end to culls and recognition of environmental and cultural value
item.description: A campaign to introduce protections to native dingoes has taken its fight to parliament house, arguing that treating dingoes as pests is causing deep cultural and environmental harm.

item.title: Winegrape growers welcome the establishment of national vineyard register
item.description: Grape growers have endured a tough few years and there are hopes that a national database will help to improve the industry's fortunes.

item.title: Flooded access road to Elkedra station
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: NT cattle stations assess flood damage, as rain in central Australia declared natural disaster
item.description: Disaster recovery funding is activated by the NT and federal governments, as flood-affected communities begin counting the cost.

item.title: Australia to focus on basics against India in second match of ODI series
item.description: Ash Gardner says mastering a simple game plan was the key to Australia's convincing six-wicket win over India in the ODI series opener Brisbane.

item.title: Raymond Reddington found guilty of murdering wife Sharon Fulton 40 years ago
item.description: A jury in the murder trial of Raymond Reddington, 79, finds him guilty of killing wife Sharon Fulton 40 years ago, despite a body not being found.

item.title: Former New Zealand prime minister Jacinda Ardern moves to Australia
item.description: Jacinda Ardern had been living with her family in the US, but a spokesperson says they are now "basing themselves out of Australia".

item.title: BOM predicts drier than average Queensland autumn, warmer nights in south-east
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology has released its long-range forecast for autumn, with drier conditions expected across Queensland from April.

item.title: Three people injured in Perth lightning strikes as beloved family pet killed
item.description: A woman describes her shock after learning her father had been seriously hurt and her dog killed in a lightning strike in suburban Perth on Thursday morning.

item.title: Former teacher Stephen Fane Noga denies allegations by former student they had sex while she was his student
item.description: Stephen Fane Noga has denied allegations he had sex with a former student while he was one of her teachers at Hobart Matriculation College in the 1980s.

item.title: Palaeontologists hope ancient whale fossil found on Victorian coast will be a window to evolution
item.description: A 21-million-year-old fossil found along Victoria's Bellarine Peninsula has been recovered in what has been described as one of the largest and most complicated excavations in the state's history.

item.title: The doctor fighting to get the families of ISIS fighters out of Syria
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Governor-General Sam Mostyn speaks with Jess Ong on ABC Radio Darwin ahead of David Connolly's swearing in.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Former Burgertory owner Hash Tayeh found to have incited racial hate at pro-Palestine rally in Melbourne
item.description: The former burger chain owner has been found to have breached Victoria's hate speech laws at a pro-Palestine rally in the CBD.

item.title: Funding axe looms for nine childcare centres failing standards
item.description: A further 19 centres put on notice last year have improved, but one has closed permanently and another is still to be assessed.

item.title: Danish PM Mette Frederiksen calls snap election after standoff with Trump over Greenland
item.description: Denmark will hold a parliamentary election on March 24, Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen announces, seeking to capitalise on a surge in support for her defiant stance against US pressure over Greenland.

item.title: Health, environment departments questioned 'evidence' cited in initial salmon antibiotic approval for florfenicol in Tasmanian waterways
item.description: Tasmania's health department and environment watchdog questioned the scientific rigour behind an application to use the antibiotic florfenicol in salmon farms, including a lack of evidence about its impact on humans, documents show.

item.title: Gold Coast couple accused of breaching freezing orders a second time amid alleged NDIS fraud investigation
item.description: It is the second time ASIC has accused David McWilliams and his wife, Laura Fullarton, of breaching freezing orders while the watchdog investigates allegations of NDIS-related fraud.

item.title: From A$AP Rocky to Megadeth — these 10 great albums got 2026 started right
item.description: This year has already given us a bounty of beautiful new records. Here are just 10 of the best we've heard so far.

item.title: What is the best wash cycle to use on your washing machine?
item.description: Eco, fast, cotton, heavy, intense cold? Experts on the most cost-effective and efficient wash cycles for your home.

item.title: Student protesters in Tehran shout "Long Live the Shah!"
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: The ABC speaks to Iran's exiled crown prince Reza Pahlavi
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Crown prince Reza Pahlavi on US military intervention in Iran and how a post Islamic Republic 'transition' would work
item.description: As the United States and Iran held their third round of nuclear talks on Thursday in Geneva amid heightened regional fears of the prospect of another war in the Middle East, Iran's exiled crown prince Reza Pahlavi says now is the time to move forward with military intervention.

item.title: How Australia's lax property tax has created a class system
item.description: Australian real estate now is among the world's most expensive, and that has made it a red-hot political issue as demographics shift.

item.title: Thousands break into property market with 5% Deposit Scheme for first home buyers
item.description: The number of people buying their first home with a 5 per cent deposit surges after the federal government makes sweeping changes to the scheme.

item.title: Myanmar military using festivals as propaganda to hide war zone
item.description: As Myanmar's junta celebrates Chin National Day in an effort to project control, air strikes on civilians underscore a deepening civil war.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: 'Proactive' Matildas aiming for Asian Cup glory under Joe Montemurro
item.description: Although filled with familiar faces, the Matildas are now a completely different side to the one that captured hearts and minds at the 2023 World Cup. This is how a "proactive" Australian side is likely to line up at the Women's Asian Cup.

item.title: Road damage bills mount as renewables rollout leaves councils feeling powerless
item.description: Regional councils hosting renewable energy infrastructure say the reality differs from what was promised, often leaving them with damage bills worth hundreds of thousands of dollars.

item.title: Indigenous people are going to jail at a record rate — what's the solution?
item.description: The number of Indigenous people behind bars is rising. But some judges are bucking the trend by taking a different approach.

item.title: HungryPanda alleges blackmail, intimidation amid dispute with delivery riders
item.description: The dispute between HungryPanda and some of its riders has taken another twist, with the food delivery company accusing some workers of intimidation and blackmail.

item.title: 'Awful' wall at Strahan subject to ridicule as Tasmanian council continues consultation
item.description: Tasmania's West Coast Council is holding monthly community meetings until April as it continues consultation over a concrete wall locals say is blocking views and restricting access to the working wharf.

item.title: Hillary Clinton slams Epstein committee for grilling her instead of Donald Trump
item.description: Hillary Clinton blasts a Republican-led congressional committee for summoning her to answer questions about Jeffrey Epstein while failing to push US President Donald Trump to do the same thing.

item.title: Scientology, Jehovah's Witnesses and Revival Centre among alleged high-control charity groups
item.description: An analysis of submissions to Victoria's inquiry into cults and fringe groups shows many of the groups hold charity status.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A lonely monkey, a BAFTA winner and the end of the Olympics
item.description: It's been a big week in the news. Did you catch these stories?

item.title: SA Liberal Party flirting with fire as One Nation preference deal looms
item.description: South Australia's embattled Liberals have openly declared their willingness to strike a preference deal with One Nation. Will it help or hurt them on election day?

item.title: Adelaide University students fear merger could extend their degrees and increase debt
item.description: Some students at Adelaide University say they are frustrated by ongoing communication and enrolment issues post-merger.

item.title: Albanese celebrates his caucus unity but it comes at a cost
item.description: Behind the scenes, the troops are carefully managed. Opinions are expressed at factional meetings and the prime minister meets with the factional conveners.

item.title: Gulf of Carpentaria residents say prolonged wet season taking a toll
item.description: Gulf of Carpentaria residents are well versed in wet season isolation, but this year locals say it could reach record levels. The extended period is taking a toll on the region and could keep towns as inland islands until Easter.

item.title: Thousands of Qld victims of crime waiting years for financial compensation
item.description: Tens of thousands of victims of property crime are owed restitution by perpetrators, with almost $50 million in debts and some victims waiting years for payment.

item.title: Flood rescues, power outages after heavy rain and flash flooding smashes Sydney
item.description: Dozens of people needed to be rescued and thousands of properties were without power after intense rainfall and flash flooding wreaked havoc across Sydney.

item.title: Tasmanian government announces stronger firearm laws in response to Bondi terror attack
item.description: The reforms include a statewide gun buyback scheme and the reclassification of some guns to a more restrictive licence, but the Tasmanian government does not plan to limit the number of firearms an individual can own.

item.title: Human remains found in Tasmanian wilderness 'provisionally identified' as Celine Cremer
item.description: Police provide their strongest statement yet that human bones found in the Tasmanian wilderness are likely those of missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer.

item.title: SES carry out 40 flood rescues in 3 hours after rain smashes Sydney
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: India beats Zimbabwe, South Africa beats West Indies at T20 World Cup as Proteas reach semifinals
item.description: The final four at the Twenty20 World Cup is taking shape after South Africa progressed on the back of a victory over West Indies, and India's victory over Zimbabwe.

item.title: Live: Labor doesn't rule out report Treasury modelling negative gearing changes
item.description: Labor frontbencher Mark Butler declines to shut the door on reports Treasury is modelling changes to negative gearing ahead of the budget. Follow live.

item.title: US and Iran make 'significant progress' in nuclear talks, mediator says
item.description: While the US did not comment after the talks ended, Iran's foreign minister told Iranian state television they had been the most intense exchanges between the two countries.

item.title: Mount Gambier council backs down on rate rise for short-stay rentals amid housing shortage
item.description: As questions persist about the effect of short-stay rental properties on housing availability, one council has cancelled plans to charge hosts higher council rates.

item.title: Bad Bunny tour unites Sydney's Latin diaspora with Australian concerts
item.description: Global powerhouse Bad Bunny is bringing together Sydney’s Latin diaspora and exciting fans who cannot speak a word of Spanish.

item.title: Live: ASX to edge up after tech rally stalls on Wall Street
item.description: The Australian share market is likely to edge higher at open after a mixed session on Wall Street. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

item.title: Georgia Griffith to collect world indoor championship bronze medal after Diribe Welteji's doping violation
item.description: Georgia Griffith looks likely to be awarded a belated world indoor championships bronze medal, her first global senior medal, after Ethiopian Diribe Welteji copped a doping ban.

item.title: Australian government launches wind turbine manufacturing consultation
item.description: The federal government is exploring the feasibility of manufacturing wind energy infrastructure locally, with the federal minister for industry saying he is "sick of the naysayers" who say local manufacturing is not sustainable.

item.title: Parents charged with manslaughter after Gold Coast crash kills 3yo boy
item.description: Police say the 22-year-old mother was driving with the 24-year-old father, along with two boys aged one and three, when she crashed into bushland at Stapylton on October 25.

item.title: Amy Sayer eager to represent Matildas at Asian Cup after long-term knee injury
item.description: After a long-term injury seriously derailed her career, Australian soccer player Amy Sayer is looking to leave a mark on this year's Asian Cup, which begins for the Matildas on Sunday in Perth.

item.title: Australian Katrina Watts's surprising journey from sumo wrestling photographer to commentator
item.description: Katrina Watts stumbled across the ancient sport while living in Japan, and became known for photographing competitors and bringing ANZAC biscuits to matches.

item.title: Seismologists investigate 'mysterious' earthquake swarm near Gnowangerup in southern WA
item.description: After a dozen earthquakes in a single day and more than 70 over the course of February, farmers in Gnowangerup are curious about what is rumbling their paddocks.

item.title: Blind refugee from Myanmar dies after detention by US border agents
item.description: Nurul Amin Shah Alam's family had expected him to be released from a New York jail and reported him missing. He was found dead after temperatures dropped below freezing.
